title: Graphic Representation and Computer-Aided Design Problem-Solving Competency Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational engineering design concepts and basic computer application skills
context.additional_context: A stepwise developmental process combining Flipped Learning, Design Thinking, Visual Thinking, and PBL in a smartphone-based microlearning environment to enhance graphic expression and CAD problem-solving skills

learning_goals: Enhance self-directed learning abilities by previewing weekly content through flipped learning and participating in online discussions at over 80%
Derive creative design solutions for at least two real-world engineering problems by applying the design thinking process
Represent complex engineering concepts using three or more visual models through visual thinking techniques
Demonstrate proficiency in computer-aided design (CAD) tools by completing one engineering project per team using a PBL approach
Validate graphic representation theory and practical application skills by achieving 70+ points on formative assessments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
